definition: standard weight (used on a balance scale)
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.english: Clear the Electronic balance and Weights gauge by alcohol.

sentences.english: For small models we can use as weights containers filled with lead shot.

sentences.english: Sheva would make an ideal addition to our attack.

sentences.english: It will increase the weight in my process of finding job.

sentences.english: They're away at Anfield in the first leg and that's a big factor.
sentences.chinese: 他們享有先客後主的優勢，這是他們晉級的最大砝碼。

sentences.chinese: 感量爲50毫克或更精密的天平，不論是否帶有砝碼。

sentences.english: The free end is provided with a fixing block or a poise for frapping the elastic thread.

sentences.english: In my dealings with people money has increasingly becoming an issue the further I've travelled.

sentences.english: The figurine was used as a suspended weight together with a balance scale.

sentences.english: Weighing instrument verification usually adopts direct plus weight method.

sentences.english: Then the merchant knew that the coins weighed the same as the counterweights on the other side.

definition: lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
ability to make one's own decisions
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
ability to have one's say and be listened to/influence/clout
